Job Duties  Analyzes and develops formalisms, algorithms and software for applications in biomedical research.  Develops and maintains software tools and infrastructure for resolving specific problems.  Oversees the development, testing and revision of programs in a team with diverse bioinformatics expertise.  Trains users and other personnel in analyzing, defining and resolving computational problems.  Other Duties: Performs other duties as assigned. Applied Clinical Informatics Practice: Analyzes and designs advanced clinical decision support tools; employs sophisticated rules and predictive analytics in electronic clinical decision support tools.Develops specialized population registries and associated electronic clinical quality measures.Develops in-Epic electronic health record dashboards and other data visualizations.Applied Clinical Informatics Research: Serves as co-Investigator/collaborator with clinicians on medical informatics clinical research projects.Writes scientific papers and presents research findings at national meetings on clinical informatics topics.Applied Clinical Informatics Education: Serve as informatics partner with medical trainees and residents on electronic health record features for quality improvement projects which are part of their education curriculum.Teaches topics in medical informatics to trainees and students.The successful candidate will have a M.S. in Bioinformatics, Biomathematics, Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnology, Computer Science, Data Science, or Software Engineering.Four (4) or more years post-graduation experience in data analysis and/or clinical software development/configuration.The successful candidate will also have the following qualifications: At least 6 months' work experience in scientific research methods, which may be concomitant with the preceding post-graduation experience.Demonstrated expertise in Epic electronic health record clinical, population health, and analytic software development/configuration, as demonstrated by three (3) or more Epic-issued proficiency or certification certificates, with at least one from each of the following two groups: (a) Clinical Group: EpicCare Ambulatory, EpicCare Inpatient, any clinical application module (ASAP, Beacon, Radiant, Stork, etc.); (b) Population Health and Analytics Group: Clarity Data Model, Data Warehouse (Caboodle), Healthy Planet, Radar Dashboards, Reporting Workbench, Research Informatics.
